timeline.bodyText: Let's rename this test class to move case specific name.
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText:
Also, let's recombine test methods from DataStorageApiServiceTest and DataStorageApiServiceCrudTest classes:

DataStorageApiServiceFileTest contains test methods associated with files/items (upload/download operations), tags
DataStorageApiServiceCommonTest the rest (crud and operations with data storages)
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: It seems that this mock used in DataStorageApiServiceRuleTest only.

timeline.bodyText: Could you please clarify why we should use mock here?
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: We may not to use times method with 1 argument due to verify method has time(1) by default
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can refuse using such method and use Collections.singleton* instead?
timeline.author: ekazachkova
ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: It is not clear which mocks we are going to init. Could you rename this method? Also, it would be great to call mockUserContext into this method.

replies.bodyText: Moreover, to my mind, we should pass s3bucket object to this method.

timeline.bodyText:
What is the difference between calls:
initAclEntity(s3bucket, AclPermission.NO_READ);

and
initAclEntity(s3bucket); ?

Let's choose a single strategy

timeline.bodyText: Looks like the result list is empty due to the fact that you didn't provide any permissions for default user - username. But you did it for SIMPLE_USER.
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: To reduce magic numbers usage and increase readability lets introduce a constants for permission masks.
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: To my mind getStreamingContent method is file related  and should be into the DataStorageApiServiceFileTest class.

ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: To my mind the temporary credentials generation is the data storage related operation. I would prefer to move it DataStorageApiSeviceCommonTest
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: It looks a bit confusing: test runs with SIMPLE_USER environment but then mocks OWNER_USER.
timeline.author: ekazachkova

replies.bodyText: It still looks a bit confusing
replies.author: ekazachkova

timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer to add at least one element to set
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText: Could we turn back constructor injection?
timeline.author: ekazachkova

timeline.bodyText:
Looks a bit confusing:

@WithMockUser(username = SIMPLE_USER) - runs test with SIMPLE_USER
initAclEntity(s3bucket, AclPermission.READ);- grants permission for SIMPLE_USER
initUserAndEntityMocks(OWNER_USER, s3bucket, context); - mocks auth for OWNER_USER

To my mind we should use one user - SIMPLE_USER for all actions.
timeline.author: ekazachkova
